item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, September 21, 2024 at 9:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. What Is a Particle? (2020) (50 points | 27 comments)
2. Tetris Game Shows Promise in Reducing PTSD Symptoms (18 points | 7 comments)
3. Analyzing the OpenAPI Tooling Ecosystem (38 points | 7 comments)
4. LHC experiments at CERN observe quantum entanglement at the highest energy yet (47 points | 1 comment)
5. Applied Mathematical Programming (38 points | 5 comments)
6. Substack (YC W18) Is Hiring Machine Learning Engineers ( | hide)
7. Scaling up linear programming with PDLP (139 points | 28 comments)
8. Ultra high-resolution image of The Night Watch (2022) (430 points | 118 comments)
9. 4 Exploits, 1 bug: exploiting cve-2024-20017 4 different ways (31 points | 1 comment)
10. Social Initiation (25 points | 7 comments)

13. In the US opioid-maker Purdue is bankrupt. Its global counterparts make millions (29 points | 8 comments)
14. Logging all C++ destructors, poor mans run-time tracing (8 points | 1 comment)

16. Omega-3 intake counteracts symptoms of anxiety and depression in mice (171 points | 78 comments)
17. The Miraculous Resurrection of Notre-Dame (27 points | 9 comments)
18. Mount Unix system into Common Lisp image (64 points | 8 comments)
19. Learning 101: The untaught basics [pdf] (43 points | 5 comments)

21. Forget ChatGPT: why researchers now run small AIs on their laptops (370 points | 225 comments)
22. A Beginner's Guide to the OpenTelemetry Collector (10 points | discuss)
23. Scientists find new blood group after 50-year mystery (72 points | 5 comments)
24. US House of Representatives adopts baseline policy for AI use (13 points | 1 comment)
25. Zdotenv – Dotenv Loader for Zig (21 points | 3 comments)
26. A plucked string simulator using Julia (8 points | discuss)
27. FCC wants all phones unlocked in sixty days, AT&T and T-Mobile aren't so keen (49 points | 41 comments)
28. The Gravo-Thermal Catastrophe (62 points | 19 comments)
29. Kubed (Emacs-based Kubernetes interface) user manual, now with pretty images (62 points | 15 comments)
30. Cold war spy satellites and AI detect ancient underground aqueducts (88 points | 13 comments)
